issue.title: when i used aws-parallelcluster 3.7.2 build-image the  cloudformation  DELETE_FAILED
issue.body:
When I use pcluster build-image, the AMI is successfully created, but there is an error during resource cleanup, I see from cloudtrail that the reason for the error is that the CleanupLambdaRole created by default does not have the getrole, ListAttachedRolePolicies ListRolePolicies and so on.
But I don't have this problem in version 3.6.1, I can reproduce this problem stably with the following commands and configuration file
pcluster build-image --image-configuration image-config.yaml --image-id testpcluster361

(pvenv) [root@AWS-CLI pcluster-test]# cat image-config.yaml
Build:
  InstanceType: c5.4xlarge
  ParentImage: ami-0b48ec38e7bb9f2d1
  SubnetId: subnet-01b7fa5bfe747ecce
  SecurityGroupIds:
    - sg-0f7e41c74de8b5dd9

comment.body: Does this have anything to do with me being at BJS?

commits.message:
Add custom munge key integration tests (#5770)

1. Deployment verification: Confirm munge key is successfully shared across head, compute and login nodes, and jobs can be submitted.
2. Rotation prep: Attempt munge key rotation without stopping compute and login nodes, expecting error messages.
3. Compute fleet shutdown: Prepare for munge key rotation scenario.
4. Key rotation without login node stop: Attempt rotation, checking for expected failure and error messages.
5. Login node stoppage and munge key rotation: Update cluster to stop login nodes, then execute munge key rotation.
6. Munge key removal: Update cluster to remove the custom munge key. Test Munge Key has been changed
7. Roll back with failure: Update cluster to add back the custom munge key. But let the cluster update fail after the custom munge key has been added. Trigger cluster roll back. Test if munge key is fully functional.

pull_request.title: [release-3.8] Add custom munge key integration tests
pull_request.body:
### Description of changes
* Test custom munge key config, rotate, update and roll back.
```
  Test phases summary:
  1. Deployment verification: Confirm munge key is successfully shared across head, compute and login nodes, and jobs
     can be submitted.
  2. Rotation prep: Attempt munge key rotation without stopping compute and login nodes, expecting error messages.
  3. Compute fleet shutdown: Prepare for munge key rotation scenario.
  4. Key rotation without login node stop: Attempt rotation, checking for expected failure and error messages.
  5. Login node stoppage and munge key rotation: Update cluster to stop login nodes, then execute munge key rotation.
  6. Munge key removal: Update cluster to remove the custom munge key. Test Munge Key has been changed
  7. Roll back with failure: Update cluster to add back the custom munge key. But let the cluster update fail after
     the custom munge key has been added. Trigger cluster roll back. Test if munge key is fully functional.
```

### Tests
* Locally running pass successfully

### Checklist
- Make sure you are pointing to **the right branch**.
- If you're creating a patch for a branch other than `develop` add the branch name as prefix in the PR title (e\.g\. `[release-3.6]`).
- Check all commits' messages are clear, describing what and why vs how.
- Make sure **to have added unit tests or integration tests** to cover the new/modified code.
- Check if documentation is impacted by this change.

Please review the [guidelines for contributing](../CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Pull Request Instructions](https://github.com/aws/aws-parallelcluster/wiki/Git-Pull-Request-Instructions).

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

commits.message:
Improve Marshmallow validation message for DatabaseName

Signed-off-by: Jacopo De Amicis <jdamicis@amazon.it>

pull_request.title: Improve Marshmallow validation message for DatabaseName
pull_request.body:
### Description of changes
* Improve Marshmallow validation message for DatabaseName.
  * By default, the validation error for Marshmallow's Regexp validator does not print the regexp being used for the validation. Adding a custom error message to the validator.

### Tests
* Manually tested the new validation message.

### References
* Develop PR: https://github.com/aws/aws-parallelcluster/pull/5796

### Checklist
- Make sure you are pointing to **the right branch**.
- If you're creating a patch for a branch other than `develop` add the branch name as prefix in the PR title (e\.g\. `[release-3.6]`).
- Check all commits' messages are clear, describing what and why vs how.
- Make sure **to have added unit tests or integration tests** to cover the new/modified code.
- Check if documentation is impacted by this change.

Please review the [guidelines for contributing](../CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Pull Request Instructions](https://github.com/aws/aws-parallelcluster/wiki/Git-Pull-Request-Instructions).

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: [release-3.8] Add custom munge key integration tests

labels.name: skip-changelog-update
labels.description: Disables the check that enforces changelog updates in PRs

issue.body:
### Description of changes
* Test custom munge key config, rotate, update and roll back.
```
  Test phases summary:
  1. Deployment verification: Confirm munge key is successfully shared across head, compute and login nodes, and jobs
     can be submitted.
  2. Rotation prep: Attempt munge key rotation without stopping compute and login nodes, expecting error messages.
  3. Compute fleet shutdown: Prepare for munge key rotation scenario.
  4. Key rotation without login node stop: Attempt rotation, checking for expected failure and error messages.
  5. Login node stoppage and munge key rotation: Update cluster to stop login nodes, then execute munge key rotation.
  6. Munge key removal: Update cluster to remove the custom munge key. Test Munge Key has been changed
  7. Roll back with failure: Update cluster to add back the custom munge key. But let the cluster update fail after
     the custom munge key has been added. Trigger cluster roll back. Test if munge key is fully functional.
```

* Locally running pass successfully

issue.title: Login Nodes Feature does not set `Tags:`
issue.body:
When using `Tags:` and `LoginNodes` in the same cluster environment, the login node creation and as a consequence the whole cluster will fail s the launch template for the Login Nodes reports "Permission denied". 

This happens on an AWS account where the presence of tags is enforced. 

Tested with AWS ParallelCluster 3.7.2

Workaround: Disable automatic rollback and manually edit Launch template for Login Node creation in order to add the requested Tags there, then retry the creation of the full stack. This time it will succeed. 

Sample template file below. 

```
Region: eu-west-1
Image:
  Os: alinux2
HeadNode:
  InstanceType: t2.micro
  Networking:
    SubnetId: subnet-xyz
  Ssh:
    KeyName: michael
Scheduling:
  Scheduler: slurm
  SlurmQueues:
  - Name: queue1
    ComputeResources:
    - Name: t2micro
      Instances:
      - InstanceType: t2.micro
      MinCount: 0
      MaxCount: 10
    Networking:
      SubnetIds:
      - subnet-xyz

LoginNodes:
  Pools:
    - Name: login
      Count: 1 
      InstanceType: t2.xlarge
      Networking:
        SubnetIds: 
          - subnet-xyz

Tags:
  - Key: rs:environment
    Value: development
  - Key: rs:project
    Value: solutions
```
